body: There was a bug in 2.2 version with delete button. Issue should be resolved when you update deeplabcut to newest version
I upgraded my DeepLabCut to 2.2b8 and still get the same error
@samueljrosen, 2.1.10.2 is the newest version. 2.2b is no longer being developed, but all features have been rolled into 2.1.10+

Ok! I just updated my DeepLabCut to the version you listed and I still get the following error:

C:\Users\rosen\Desktop\Rosen_DeepLabCut\Melano_DLC_Rosen-Melano_DLC_Rosen-2021-03-03\training-datasets\iteration-0\UnaugmentedDataSet_Melano_DLC_RosenMar3  already exists!
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\create_training_dataset.py", line 385, in create_training_dataset
    augmenter_type=self.aug_choice.GetValue(),
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 1020, in create_training_dataset
    Data, trainIndices, nbodyparts, project_path
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 793, in format_training_data
    img_shape = _read_image_shape_fast(os.path.join(project_path, filename))
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\generate_training_dataset\trainingsetmanipulation.py", line 777, in _read_image_shape_fast
    return io.imread(path).shape
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\skimage\io\_io.py", line 48, in imread
    img = call_plugin('imread', fname, plugin=plugin, **plugin_args)
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\skimage\io\manage_plugins.py", line 209, in call_plugin
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\skimage\io\_plugins\imageio_plugin.py", line 10, in imread
    return np.asarray(imageio_imread(*args, **kwargs))
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\functions.py", line 265, in imread
    reader = read(uri, format, "i", **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\functions.py", line 172, in get_reader
    request = Request(uri, "r" + mode, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\request.py", line 124, in __init__
    self._parse_uri(uri)
  File "C:\Users\rosen\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\imageio\core\request.py", line 260, in _parse_uri
    raise FileNotFoundError("No such file: '%s'" % fn)
FileNotFoundError: No such file: 'C:\Users\rosen\Desktop\Rosen_DeepLabCut\Melano_DLC_Rosen-Melano_DLC_Rosen-2021-03-03\labeled-data\022221_Melano_Video001_SOFT\img8101.png'

If there's any additional information you would like me to post, please let me know since I don't know why it keeps throwing errors for deleted frames. I did delete the frames in the old version, would I have to do relabeling in this version of DeepLabCut?

Maybe there are annotation entries left in CollectedData. Please use `deeplabcut.dropannotationfileentriesduetodeletedimages(config)` and see what happens. Try and check_labels after to see if everything is okay with your labelling.
Yes, that's a thorny one. You need to carefully compare images & annotations, with the helper functions mentioned by @KonradDanielewski (also more in the user guide) and then it should be fine!

Here's the somehow similar error I am facing atm!
I had a project setup and working on the server; I was wanting to add a new participant to the dataset; hence labelled data from that new participant.
Then I created a new project on the server by including video from the new participant in the initial set-up. Then copied the previous "labeled-data" folder to the new project and also uploaded/added the labeled data (including the .csv and .h5 files) from my pc to the "labeled-data";
I face the 
".......raise FileNotFoundError("No such file: '%s'" % fn)
FileNotFoundError: No such file:" 
error once I want to create the training dataset! 
The "deeplabcut.dropannotationfileentriesduetodeletedimages(config)" command drops all the images related to the subject that I have labeled on my pc (and removes the markers coordinates from the .csv file :-( )! not sure what I should do to solve this. I would appreciate if you could comment on that, please?

You mean you wanted to add new videos to the dataset? If so, then you should just add the video to the project, label frames and create new trainig dataset after which you change init_weights in pose_cfg.yaml and add path to your snapshot from model trained on previous subjects. I don't quite follow why you created a whole new project. 

The first error is probably caused by the path missmatch in config.yaml on your computer vs after uploading to server.

The `deeplabcut.dropannotationfileentriesduetodeletedimages(config)` will remove annotation data if no PNGs are present in the labeled_data folder of corresponding video.

Correct, I was wanting to add new videos ... but it's so hard to do it while working on the server due to display lag etc! so I decided to do the labeling on the desktop pc, define a new project on the server including the new videos, and then transfer the "labeled-data" folder from the pc to the server.

Anyway, I feel like I know what the problem is, but I don't know how I'd be able to fix it! it's definitely related to path issues.
I noticed that all the paths to the images in the .csv file from the previous dataset in the 'labeled-data' folder on the server have "/" to address the path/images (e.g., labeled-data/P08_ML/img0002.png); ; whereas the .csv file for the new participant shows " \ " instead (e.g., labeled-data\P10_ML\img0018.png). I think all the " \ "s need to be changed to "/"s. Now wonder how'd be possible to edit this in the .h5 file as I am sure DLC reads from that and not from the .csv file?

Thanks again

The reason for the path separator difference is that you must have labeled the new data on a windows computer.

```
deeplabcut.convertannotationdata_fromwindows2unixstyle(config_path, userfeedback=True, win2linux=True)
```

will ask you (`userfeedback=True`) if you want to convert each video in your `config`, and will convert "\" (windows) to "/" (unix) in the labeled data for those videos. 

If you can't use a GUI on the server for labelling due to lag, I strongly suggest copying your full project folder to your local PC and back to your server (or use some kind of network storage that both computers can access). Unless you are very familiar with the deeplabcut workflow and code, editing the folder structure directly can cause big problems that are hard to track down.

Thanks very much for the wonderful comment.
the "deeplabcut.convertannotationdata_fromwindows2unixstyle" command did solve everything and I am back to deeplabcutting!

issue.title: deeplabcut.create_training_dataset: "FileNotFoundError: No such file:"

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Some similar questions regarding the step have been asked in the platform, but since none could solve my issue I was wondering if I can receive any feedback.

I run into FileNotFound error upon running the line "deeplabcut.create_training_dataset(config_path)."

(1) The path should not be wrong because I can run "deeplabcut.check_labels(cong_path)" with no problem. 

(2) In addition, the file that is said to be non-existent in the error does indeed exist within labeled-data folder. 

I would appreciate any small hints. Thank you so much in advance!


BELOW IS THE CODE 
```
In [8]: deeplabcut.create_training_dataset(config_path)                         
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
FileNotFoundError                         Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-c980124be66b> in <module>

   1007                 ################################################################################
   1008                 data, MatlabData = format_training_data(
-> 1009                     Data, trainIndices, nbodyparts, project_path
   1010                 )
   1011                 sio.savemat(

    788         filename = df.index[i]
    789         data["image"] = filename
--> 790         img_shape = _read_image_shape_fast(os.path.join(project_path, filename))
    791         try:
    792             data["size"] = img_shape[2], img_shape[0], img_shape[1]

/usr/local/bin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/generate_training_dataset/trainingsetmanipulation.py in _read_image_shape_fast(path)
    772 @lru_cache(maxsize=None)
    773 def _read_image_shape_fast(path):
--> 774     return io.imread(path).shape
    775 
    776 

/usr/local/bin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/skimage/io/_io.py in imread(fname, as_gray, plugin, **plugin_args)
     46 
     47     with file_or_url_context(fname) as fname:
---> 48         img = call_plugin('imread', fname, plugin=plugin, **plugin_args)
     49 
     50     if not hasattr(img, 'ndim'):

/usr/local/bin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/skimage/io/manageplugins.py in call_plugin(kind, *args, **kwargs)
    207                                (plugin, kind))
    208 
--> 209     return func(*args, **kwargs)
    210 
    211 

/usr/local/bin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/skimage/io/_plugis/imageio_plugin.py in imread(*args, **kwargs)
      8 @wraps(imageio_imread)
      9 def imread(*args, **kwargs):
---> 10     return np.asarray(imageio_imread(*args, **kwargs))

/usr/local/bin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/imageio/core/funcions.py in imread(uri, format, **kwargs)
    263 
    264     # Get reader and read first
--> 265     reader = read(uri, format, "i", **kwargs)
    266     with reader:
    267         return reader.get_data(0)

/usr/local/bin/anaconda3/envs/DLC/lib/python3.7/site-packages/imageio/core/funcions.py in get_reader(uri, format, mode, **kwargs)
    170 
    171     # Create request object
--> 172     request = Request(uri, "r" + mode, **kwargs)
    173
```

issue.title: Issue when runing training on cluster

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body: ### Is there an existing issue for this? - [X] I have searched the existing issues ### Bug description I faile to run the training on a cluster (via docker installation). This installation works for multi-animal project (at least the analysis - never trained a MAmodel with this installation). - This time I'm working on a single animal model. - On the GUI, I start a new project and run all the steps until 'create training dataset'. - Then I transfert all my project folder on my virtual machine (when the docker is installed) - And when I run the command for the training, it returns: And indeed, my "training-datasets" folder is empty. Is a file missing there? Why? FYI: I'm using resnet_50 network for training. Thank you, Cheers, ### Operating System The GUI part of the project was done on Windows 10. ### DeepLabCut version 2.2.0.3 ### DeepLabCut mode single animal ### Device type gpu ### Steps To Reproduce _No response_ ### Relevant log output _No response_ ### Anything else? _No response_ ### Code of Conduct - [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
